meanings.definition: Relating to the philosophy of law.
meanings.sent1: Her jurisprudential approach to legal matters was thoughtful and reflective.
meanings.sent2: The professor's jurisprudential analysis of the case provided valuable insights.
meanings.sent3: The jurisprudential debate at the conference was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: His jurisprudential perspective shed new light on the ethical implications.
meanings.sent5: The jurisprudential principles guided the decision-making process effectively.

meanings.definition: A theory or philosophy of law.
meanings.sent1: Studying different jurisprudential theories can broaden your understanding of law.
meanings.sent2: The book delves into various jurisprudential perspectives on justice.
meanings.sent3: The jurisprudential discussion at the seminar sparked interesting debates.
meanings.sent4: His unique jurisprudential framework challenged traditional legal norms.
meanings.sent5: Understanding jurisprudential concepts is crucial for legal scholars.

meanings.definition: The study or science of law.
meanings.sent1: Her interest in jurisprudential studies led her to pursue a career in law.
meanings.sent2: The university offers a comprehensive program in jurisprudential studies.
meanings.sent3: The jurisprudential research project required extensive data analysis.
meanings.sent4: The evolution of jurisprudential practices has shaped modern legal systems.
meanings.sent5: Engaging in jurisprudential research enhances legal knowledge.
